content: little butterfly this pattern is written in uk terms hook size 4mm hook throughout yarn your preferred brand of double knitting colour a - yellow colour b - pink colour c - teal abbreviations half_double_crochet - half treble_crochet treble_crochet - treble_crochet dtr - double treble_crochet chain - chain st - stitch magic_ring - magic_ring slip_stitch - slip_stitch finished butterfly measures roughly 9cm by 7cm wings round 1 using colour a make magic_ring into magic_ring work ch5 1tr ch2 1tr ch1 1tr ch2 1tr ch5 slip_stitch turn work and do not tighten magic_ring yet round 2 working in chain spaces from round 1 slip_stitch twice into 5ch space ch3 2tr ch2 2tr 1htr into same 5ch space 1htr 2tr ch2 1tr 1htr into next 2ch space slip_stitch into 1ch space 1htr 1tr ch2 2tr 1htr into next 2ch space 1htr 2tr ch2 2tr ch3 into next 5ch space slip_stitch twice into same 5ch space join with slip_stitch into magic_ring fasten off colour a and tighten magic_ring do not turn work round 3 join colour b into 3ch space of top left wing and work 3tr 3dtr 3tr into 2ch space slip_stitch into top of first treble_crochet of first round indicted by arrow ch1 9tr into next 2ch space and slip_stitch into 1ch space of first round indicted by arrow then work 9tr into next 2ch space ch1 slip_stitch into top of fourth treble_crochet of first round indicted by arrow 3tr 3dtr 3tr into next 2ch space and finish by joining with slip_stitch into 3ch space at top right wing fasten_off colour b and sew in ends little butterfly | no 2 | love woodcraft 2020 body with colour c make a magic_ring leaving a long tail and ch10 cut a long tail do not remove st from hook and pass it through the magic_ring as shown in first photo slide the chain circle onto the butterfly with the wrong side of the chain facing outwards and the magic_ring end of the chain to the front of the butterfly now tighten the magic_ring so that it is directly next to the stitch still on the hook now to make the antenna continue with the stitch still on the hook and with the cut tail ch4 then make a tight slip knot pass the now empty hook under the 10-chain loop and pull through a loop through using the long tail from the magic_ring at the beginning work ch4 then make a tight slipknot cut the tails of the two antenna to roughly 2cm from the knots and tease out the ends … you now have your own butterfly finished butterfly is very versatile they can be used on anything from blankets and bags to mobiles and hanging decorations it can be sewn onto blankets or bags by sewing around the edges of colour b to make the butterflies into hanging decorations attach string to the top of the body behind antenna i d love to see your own creations share and tag
